definition: pet/favorite/darling
to love/to pamper/to spoil/to favor
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final

sentences.english: Though she meant well, she was often chastised for being the teacher's pet.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她是好意，可她因为是老师的宠儿而常被惩罚。

sentences.english: All offered up sacrifices to the minion of fortune.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人都情愿为这个命运的宠儿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: Soames had always been their pet .
sentences.chinese: 索末斯一直就是她们的宠儿。

sentences.english: The Longjing tea is one of China's best green teas. It has been a favourite among wealthy buyers.
sentences.chinese: 龙井茶是中国最好的绿茶之一，是富有买家的宠儿。

sentences.english: She died in the hospital petted by all her nurses.
sentences.chinese: 作为医护人员的宠儿她死在医院里。

sentences.english: Chapter four investigates postmodernist language deviation in Beloved.
sentences.chinese: 第四章研究了《宠儿》中的后现代语言变异。

sentences.english: Former Wall Street darling Enron collapses in accounting scandal, filing for bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 前华尔街宠儿安然公司由于会计丑闻倒闭，宣告破产。

sentences.english: Not to mention the perfect pal for your drinking needs is not far from a pork and kimchi stir-fry.
sentences.chinese: 当然用蛋包配上泡菜炒猪肉绝对是下酒菜的新宠儿。

sentences.english: Henman is the golden boy of British tennis this season.
sentences.chinese: 亨曼是本季英国网球赛的宠儿。

sentences.english: She was his favorite and could speak to him so impudently .
sentences.chinese: 她是他的宠儿，可以那样无礼他说话。

sentences.english: She had resolved to make a pet of her little c in.
sentences.chinese: 她已经决定把她的小表弟当作一个宠儿。

sentences.english: In January you will become the zodiac's most favorite child!
sentences.chinese: 一月，你会成为黄道十二宫的新宠儿。

sentences.english: Favourite having been in England, was admired by Dahlia and Zephine.
sentences.chinese: 宠儿到英国去过一趟，因此瑟芬和大丽都羡慕她。

sentences.english: This pervert's delight has an MSRP of $99.
sentences.chinese: 这个变态的新宠儿的建议零售价是美金99元。

sentences.english: Am I you cosset for ever?
sentences.chinese: 我会是你永远的宠儿吗？

sentences.english: She was the darling of cafe society.
sentences.chinese: 她是咖啡馆社交界的宠儿。

definition: current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
a best-seller/a hot property
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
pronoun/synonym/byword
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
to focus attention upon
to treasure/to be very fond of
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
most outstanding/par excellence
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
vane/propellor blade/weather vane/windsock
focus/focal point
